Author: bouch#7580
Content: My plan is to install Verus on two machines. On my crypto only wallet laptop I'm going to create a new seed which will generate a new address. On a different PC I'm going to install Verus again and import my compromised seed and transfer funds to the new Verus generated address on my laptop. I will start with a small amount and check it went through, both via the laptop wallet and the block exploer: https://kmd.explorer.dexstats.info/ Once I get my KMD back, I'm likely going to move it to a ledger address.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
For Lite mode users:
https://github.com/VerusCoin/Agama/releases/tag/v0.6.0.13-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview download that
it is safe
first create a new wallet (new seed)
note down the address
then import the old seed (compromised), send all funds to the new address
if "electrum error" or "get_balance error", follow this guide: https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000029569-how-to-stop-agama-from-using-a-proxy-server-to-access-electrum-servers/
